text.section: There is a Maryland Hospital Bond Program in the Authority.

For public obligations issued on behalf of a hospital before October 1, 2008, the Program shall provide for the payment and refinancing of public obligations of a hospital, if:
the closure of the hospital is in accordance with § 19-120(l) of the Health - General Article; or
the delicensure of the hospital is in accordance with § 19-325 of the Health - General Article;
a public obligation issued on behalf of the hospital is outstanding; and
the hospital plan for closure or delicensure and the related financing plan is acceptable to:
the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene, in consultation with the Maryland Health Care Commission; and
the Authority.

For public obligations issued on behalf of a hospital on or after October 1, 2008, the Program shall provide for the payment and refinancing of public obligations of a hospital, if:
the closure of the hospital is in accordance with § 19-120(l) of the Health - General Article; or
the delicensure of the hospital is in accordance with § 19-325 of the Health - General Article;
a public obligation issued on behalf of the hospital is outstanding;
the hospital plan for closure or delicensure and the related financing plan is acceptable to:
the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene, in consultation with the Maryland Health Care Commission; and
the Authority; and
the Health Services Cost Review Commission determines that implementation of the Program is in the public interest, taking into account the amount of system-wide savings to the health care system in the State that might be expected as a result of the closure.
